analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa la mal cha / me tog 'dod pa la me tog /
translated: To those who want bedding, he gives bedding.🔽To those who want flowers, he gives flowers.

original: bdug @148a *// pa 'dod pa la bdug pa /🔽spos 'dod pa la spos /🔽phreng ba 'dod pa la phreng ba /
analyzed: bdug @148a *// pa 'dod pa la bdug pa / spos 'dod pa la spos / phreng ba 'dod pa la phreng ba /
translated: To those who want incense, he gives incense.🔽To those who want perfume, he gives perfume.🔽To those who want garlands, he gives garlands.

original: byug pa 'dod pa la byug pa /
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa la byug pa /
translated: To those who want ointments, he gives ointments.

original: gnas 'dod pa la gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa la gnas /
translated: He gives to those who want a home a home,

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa la /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul 'dod pa la /
translated: and to those who want wealth, grain, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, gold, and silver,

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / 'tshog chas dang / yo byad gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang de 'dod pa rnams la yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / beed'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / gser dang / dngul dang / 'tshog chas dang / yo byad gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang de 'dod pa rnams la yongs su gtong ste /
translated: he gives wealth, grain, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, gold, silver, and other necessities and implements.

original: de bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
analyzed: de bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
translated: He himself practices the perfection of generosity,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: and he also encourages others to practice the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: He praises the perfection of generosity,

original: gzhan gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: and he also praises those others who practice the perfection of generosity, welcoming it and praising it.

original: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
analyzed: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod la /
translated: I myself should practice the perfection of morality,

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: and I should encourage others to take up the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: I should speak in praise of the perfection of morality,

original: gzhan gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: and I should praise those who practice the perfection of morality, welcoming it with delight.

original: bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: I myself should practice the perfection of patience,

original: gzhan yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: and I should encourage others to take up the perfection of patience.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i @148b legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i @148b legs pa brjod do //
translated: I should speak in praise of the perfection of patience,

original: gzhan gang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: and I should praise those who practice the perfection of patience, welcoming it with delight.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: I myself should practice the perfection of perseverance,🔽and I should encourage others to take up the perfection of perseverance.

original: gzhan yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: They also encourage others to practice the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: They speak in praise of the perfection of effort.

original: gzhan gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: They speak in praise of others who practice the perfection of effort, and they rejoice in it.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: They themselves practice the perfection of concentration.

original: gzhan yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: They also encourage others to practice the perfection of concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: They speak in praise of the perfection of concentration.

original: gzhan gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: They speak in praise of others who practice the perfection of concentration, and they rejoice in it.

original: bdag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: They themselves practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par skul lo //
translated: They also encourage others to practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa brjod do //
translated: they praise the perfection of wisdom;

original: gzhan gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de dag gi'ang legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar byed do //
translated: and they also praise those others who practice the perfection of wisdom, and they rejoice in that.

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni khyim na gnas na /🔽dzambu'i gling rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni khyim na gnas na / dzambu'i gling rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: “Subhūti, if those irreversible bodhisattva great beings are living in a home,🔽they give gifts by filling up the world with the seven precious stones;

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna @149a *//🔽bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /🔽stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna @149a *// bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: they give gifts by filling up the four-continent world with the seven precious stones;🔽they give gifts by filling up the thousand world systems with the seven precious stones;🔽they give gifts by filling up the two-thousand world systems with the seven precious stones;

original: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
analyzed: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong /
translated: they give gifts by filling up the great billion world systems with the seven precious stones;

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong yang de 'dod pa la yongs su mi spyod de /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna bdun gyis yongs su bkang zhing sbyin pa yongs su gtong yang de 'dod pa la yongs su mi spyod de /
translated: “Even if they were to give away a world system of a billion worlds filled with the seven precious substances, they would not be interested in that.

original: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par tshangs par spyod pa yin /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi chad par tshangs par spyod pa yin /
translated: They always practice pure conduct.

original: gnod pa gang gis gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa de lta bu gang yang mi skyed de /
analyzed: gnod pa gang gis gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i gnod pa de lta bu gang yang mi skyed de /
translated: They do not cause any harm that would displease others.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, who have those signs, who have those marks are irreversible.

original: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir bzhin du /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings who have the attributes of irreversibility

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni ring po mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will before long fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: 'di bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: When he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bdag gis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gis rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: I will always and constantly follow him.’

original: gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: Because of that protection, Vajrapāṇi always and constantly follows him.

original: ji tsam du lag na rdo rje'i @149b rigs rnams rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang ba de tsam du /
analyzed: ji tsam du lag na rdo rje'i @149b rigs rnams rtag tu rgyun mi chad par rjes su 'brang ba de tsam du /
translated: To the extent that the Vajrapāṇi family always and constantly follows him,

original: de la mi 'am /
analyzed: de la mi 'am /
translated: to that extent humans

original: mi ma yin pa dag gis gnod par mi nus te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa dag gis gnod par mi nus te /
translated: and non-humans are unable to harm him.

original: de la 'jig rten na lha'am /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten na lha'am /
translated: In the world no one can overcome him🔽in accordance with the Dharma—no god,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: demon, Brahmā,

original: gang sus kyang chos dang mthun par thub pa med de /
analyzed: gang sus kyang chos dang mthun par thub pa med de /
translated: or anyone else.

original: de'i sems byang chub yid la byed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par 'khrug pa med do //
analyzed: de'i sems byang chub yid la byed pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par 'khrug pa med do //
translated: From the time when he first begins to set his mind on enlightenment, his mind is never disturbed until he has attained supreme enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dbang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de'i dbang po 'di lta ste /
translated: The faculties of that bodhisattva mahāsattva, namely,

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the mind faculty, the faith faculty, the heroism faculty, the mindfulness faculty,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po dag ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the concentration faculty, and the wisdom faculty, are never incomplete.

original: de ni skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes a holy being,

original: skyes bu dma' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dma' ba ma yin no //
translated: not a low person.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam par 'gyur zhing skyes bu dma' ba ma lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam byang chub kyi sems mi 'khrug pa na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam par 'gyur zhing skyes bu dma' ba ma lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam byang chub kyi sems mi 'khrug pa na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes bu dam par 'gyur te /
translated: “To what extent do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas become true men and not false men?”

original: skyes bu dma' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dma' ba ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha replied, “Subhūti, when Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas do not lose the thought of enlightenment, they become true men and not false men.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang @150a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang @150a *//
translated: Subhūti, Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who have these attributes, these ways of being, and these signs

original: ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub yid la bya ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni byang chub yid la bya ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas are endowed with the thought of enlightenment and are

original: bud med ze slong ba dang / dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang tshig gang ci'ang rung ste /
analyzed: bud med ze slong ba dang / dbang du 'gyur ba'i sngags dang tshig gang ci'ang rung ste /
translated: or any mantra or words for the sake of women, or for the sake of gaining power over others,

original: rtsi de dag thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mi sbyor /
analyzed: rtsi de dag thams cad du thams cad rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mi sbyor /
translated: he should not use any of those substances,

original: sbyor du mi 'jug ste /🔽ze slong ba'i bag gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang mi byed do //🔽bud med dam skyes pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: sbyor du mi 'jug ste / ze slong ba'i bag gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang mi byed do // bud med dam skyes pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: he should not cause them to be used,🔽and he should not cause others to engage in any of those practices.

original: de dag la yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul mi byed do //🔽bu'am bu mo rigs kyi lha lta bu yod par 'gyur ro zhe 'am /
analyzed: de dag la yongs su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul mi byed do // bu'am bu mo rigs kyi lha lta bu yod par 'gyur ro zhe 'am /
translated: He should not perform miracles for the sake of women or men,🔽saying, ‘If you do this, you will have a son or a daughter who is like a god,’

original: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes yongs su ston pa'i cho 'phrul mi byed do /
analyzed: tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes yongs su ston pa'i cho 'phrul mi byed do /
translated: or ‘You will have a long life.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos rnams la mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings do not see any signs in phenomena that are empty of their own marks.

original: des mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
analyzed: des mtshan ma yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas /
translated: He does not see any sign of a life,

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: and so his livelihood is pure.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @150b sems dpa' chen po rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ba'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @150b sems dpa' chen po rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog par rig par bya ba'i rnam pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those modes, and those signs are irreversible.

original: tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag bstan gyi /
analyzed: tshul dang / mtshan ma de dag bstan gyi /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, I will teach the attributes, the modes, and the signs with which you should know that bodhisattva great beings are irreversible.

original: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad do //
analyzed: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang bshad do //
translated: Listen carefully and pay attention! I will explain.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: de ltar bgyi'o zhes gsol nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: it is good.”

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyir nyan to //
translated: The venerable Subhūti listened to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to him:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba yin te /🔽phung po'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /🔽khams kyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: byang chub yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba yin te / phung po'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas / khams kyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: they are never separated from the attention of awakening.🔽They do not remain intent on the application of the aggregates,🔽they do not remain intent on the application of the constituents,

original: skye mched kyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: skye mched kyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: they do not remain intent on the application of the sense fields,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: and they do not remain intent on the application of dependent origination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des phung po stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /🔽khams stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des phung po stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin / khams stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
translated: It is because those bodhisattva great beings have thoroughly brought to mind the emptiness of the aggregates,🔽have thoroughly brought to mind the emptiness of the constituents,

original: skye mched stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
analyzed: skye mched stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
translated: and have thoroughly brought to mind the emptiness of the sense fields.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
translated: They have thoroughly taken to mind the emptiness of dependent origination.

original: de 'du 'dzi'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de 'du 'dzi'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: They do not persist in being occupied with the affairs of crowds.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' @151a *//
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' @151a *//
translated: Because bodhisattva great beings

original: sems dpa' chen po des sems can stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po des sems can stong pa nyid shin tu yid la byas pa yin /
translated: have thoroughly taken to mind the emptiness of beings.

original: de rgyal po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rgyal po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: They do not persist in being occupied with the affairs of kings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la'ang bzang po 'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang la'ang bzang po 'am /
translated: And why?

original: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngan par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because, abiding in the emptiness of intrinsic nature, they do not see any phenomenon as good or bad.

original: de rkun po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de rkun po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: They do not persist in being occupied with the affairs of thieves.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas chos gang la'ang blang ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pas chos gang la'ang blang ba'am /
translated: Because, since all phenomena are empty of their own marks, they do not apprehend any phenomenon as something to be adopted or rejected.

original: dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any taking away.

original: de yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: de yul gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: “He does not engage in conversation about countries.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung ngu'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang nyung ngu'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mang por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because he is established in the emptiness of inherent existence, he does not see any dharma as few or many.

original: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: “He does not engage in conversation about armies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas /🔽chos gang la'ang byams pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la gnas pas / chos gang la'ang byams pa'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhe sdang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because he is established in the suchness of all dharmas, he does not see any dharma as loving or hateful.

original: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: “He does not engage in conversation about villages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang tshogs sam /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pas chos gang yang tshogs sam /
translated: Because he is established in the emptiness of all dharmas, he does not see any dharma as a gathering or a dispersion.

original: tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi @151b mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshogs ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mi @151b mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any assembly or non-assembly.

original: grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not engage in the practice of talking about towns.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de nam mkha' stong pa nyid la gnas pas /
translated: Because he abides in the emptiness of space,

original: chos gang yang gzung pa'am; mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang yang gzung pa'am; mi gzung bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see any phenomena to be grasped or not grasped.

original: grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
analyzed: grong rdal gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas te /
translated: He does not engage in the practice of talking about villages.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas /
translated: Because he abides in the limit of reality,

original: chos gang yang 'phel ba'am /🔽'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos gang yang 'phel ba'am / 'grib par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: he does not see any phenomena to increase or🔽decrease.

original: bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /🔽sems can gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas / sems can gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: He does not engage in the practice of talking about self,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about sentient beings,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about life,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about person,

original: srog gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: srog gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: he does not engage in the practice of talking about human being,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about born of strength,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about born of Varuṇa,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about born of Brahmā,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about created,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about uncreated,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about compounded,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about uncompounded,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about conditioned,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about unconditioned,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about nirvāṇa,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about saṃsāra,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the past,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the future,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the present,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three times,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three realms,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three vehicles,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three knowledges,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three superknowledges,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three doors of liberation,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three concentrations,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three kinds of patience,🔽he does not engage in the practice of talking about the three kinds of good roots,

original: 'gro ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of the world.

original: gso ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /🔽skyes bu'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: gso ba'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas / skyes bu'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of medicine.🔽They do not engage in the discourse of human beings.

original: gang zag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /🔽shed can gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: gang zag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas / shed can gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of persons.🔽They do not engage in the discourse of the one who has power.

original: shed bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: shed bdag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of the lord of power.🔽They do not engage in the discourse of the agent.

original: byed pa po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas; tshor ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
analyzed: byed pa po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas; tshor ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of the experiencer.

original: shes pa po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas /🔽mthong ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson @152a *//
analyzed: shes pa po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas / mthong ba po'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson @152a *//
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of the knower.

original: par mi gnas te /
analyzed: par mi gnas te /
translated: They do not engage in the discourse of the seer.

original: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan du na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la rjes su brtson zhing rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dang ma bral bar gnas te /
translated: Otherwise, they would be engaged in the practice of the perfection of wisdom, and they would not be separated from the mental activity associated with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They would practice the perfection of generosity,

original: ser sna'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: ser sna'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but they would not be engaged in the practice of stinginess.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They would practice the perfection of moral discipline,

original: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but they would not be engaged in the practice of immorality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They would practice the perfection of patience,🔽but they would not be engaged in the practice of anger.

original: 'khrug pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so; ;brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so; ;brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They would practice the perfection of perseverance,

original: le lo'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: le lo'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but they would not be engaged in the practice of laziness.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They would practice the perfection of concentration,

original: g-yeng ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: They do not engage in the practice of distraction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab 'chal ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal ba'i sbyor ba la rjes su brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: and do not engage in the practice of bad wisdom.

original: de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
analyzed: de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the emptiness of all phenomena

original: chos 'dod pa yin gyi chos mi 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa yin gyi chos mi 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: and are not averse to the Dharma.

original: de chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing /
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the realm of phenomena

original: chos tha dad pa'i legs pa brjod pa ma yin /
analyzed: chos tha dad pa'i legs pa brjod pa ma yin /
translated: and do not praise the excellence of different phenomena.

original: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du sems pa yin /🔽rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos dang / rang @152b sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du sems pa yin / rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo nyan thos dang / rang @152b sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa gang ji snyed pa de dag kyang /
translated: They think of the blessed buddhas and the bodhisattva great beings as spiritual friends,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par skul zhing 'god do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par skul zhing 'god do //
translated: and they encourage and establish in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as many sons of noble family and daughters of noble family as there are in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: 'dul lo / rab tu gzhog go /
analyzed: 'dul lo / rab tu gzhog go /
translated: They train them,🔽and they establish them in the Great Vehicle.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed cing /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed cing /
translated: They please the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas,

original: blta ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gang na bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba der skyes te /
analyzed: blta ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gang na bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba der skyes te /
translated: and are reborn in the world systems in which they live and remain and are present in order to see them.

original: der skye bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: der skye bar 'dod cing /
translated: They are reborn there,

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas yid la bya pas nyin mtshan du rnam par spyod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas yid la bya pas nyin mtshan du rnam par spyod de /
translated: and in this way, with their minds directed toward the Buddha, they practice day and night.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni phal cher 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni phal cher 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba bskyed cing /
translated: Subhūti, it is because those irreversible bodhisattva great beings mostly give rise to thoughts connected with the desire realm,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas nas /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas nas /
translated: and, abiding in the ten wholesome actions,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are reborn in those buddha fields.

original: bsam gtan dang po bskyed /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po bskyed /
translated: They give rise to the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa bskyed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa bskyed /
translated: give rise to the second concentration,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa bskyed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa bskyed /
translated: give rise to the third concentration,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed /🔽byams pa bskyed /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bskyed / byams pa bskyed /
translated: give rise to the fourth concentration,🔽give rise to loving kindness,

original: snying rje bskyed /
analyzed: snying rje bskyed /
translated: give rise to compassion,

original: dga' ba bskyed /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed /
translated: they should generate joy,

original: btang snyoms bskyed /
analyzed: btang snyoms bskyed /
translated: they should generate equanimity,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
translated: they should generate the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
translated: they should generate the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed /
translated: they should generate the meditative absorption of the sense field of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed cing /🔽gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @153a *//
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed cing / gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @153a *//
translated: they should generate the meditative absorption of the sense field of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa der skyes te /
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mngon du gyur par bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba dang / chos ston pa der skyes te /
translated: and they should be reborn where the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas are manifest, alive, and enduring, and where they are teaching the sacred doctrine,🔽Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those tokens, and those signs are irreversible.”

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings do not have the view of a real self,🔽do not have the view of a real being,🔽do not have the view of a real living soul,🔽and do not have the view of a real person.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /🔽nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa / nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / phyi stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / chen po stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽dwell in inner emptiness, dwell in outer emptiness, dwell in inner and outer emptiness, dwell in the emptiness of emptiness, dwell in great emptiness,

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
translated: dwell in ultimate emptiness, dwell in conditioned emptiness, dwell in unconditioned emptiness, dwell in the emptiness of beyond extremes, dwell in the emptiness of no beginning and no end,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to abide in the emptiness of non-rejection, the emptiness of the nature of non-entities, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, and the emptiness of the non-apprehension of phenomena.🔽It is to abide in the emptiness of the non-apprehension of anything, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of the non-apprehension of phenomena,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong @153b pa nyid la gnas pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la gnas pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong @153b pa nyid la gnas pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities. It is to abide in the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams la gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la gnas pa dang / dbang po rnams la gnas pa dang / stobs rnams la gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la gnas pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams la gnas pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la gnas pa dang / dbang po rnams la gnas pa dang / stobs rnams la gnas pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la gnas pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la gnas pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la gnas pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la gnas pa dang / bsam gtan rnams la gnas pa dang / tshad med pa rnams la gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la gnas pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad la gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to abide in the noble truths, to abide in the concentrations, to abide in the immeasurables, to abide in the formless absorptions, and to abide in the eight aspects of liberation.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la gnas pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la gnas pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams la gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to abide in the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, to abide in emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, to abide in the higher cognitions, to abide in the meditative stabilities,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la gnas pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la gnas pa dang / byams pa chen po la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams la gnas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la gnas pa dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams la gnas pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams la gnas pa dang / byams pa chen po la gnas pa dang /
translated: to abide in the dhāraṇī gateways, to abide in the powers of the tathāgatas, to abide in the fearlessnesses, to abide in the detailed and thorough knowledges, to abide in great love,

original: snying rje chen po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas pa ni 'di snyam du bdag ni phyir ldog pa'am /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la gnas pa ni 'di snyam du bdag ni phyir ldog pa'am /
translated: Those who abide in great compassion and the eighteen unmixed qualities of the Buddha do not think, I will regress or🔽

original: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no snyam yang mi byed de /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no snyam yang mi byed de /
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings who stand in the perfection of wisdom and the perfection of concentration, and who stand in the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, and who stand in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, do not think, ‘I am turning back from the knowledge of all aspects, or I am not turning back from the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: de the tshom mi skye @154a *//
analyzed: de the tshom mi skye @154a *//
translated: They do not have any doubt about that.

original: zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do //
analyzed: zhing rang gi sa la yid gnyis med do //
translated: They do not have any uncertainty about their own stage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar des phyir ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa ma yin pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i skyes bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des phyir ldog pa dang / phyir ldog pa ma yin pa'i chos rdul tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i skyes bu rgyun du zhugs pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Because they do not see any dharma at all that turns back or does not turn back.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o / lan cig phyir 'ong ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: “To illustrate, Subhūti, a person who is a stream enterer does not have any uncertainty or doubt about the stream enterer’s stage.🔽A once-returner does not have any uncertainty or doubt about the once-returner’s stage.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: A non-returner does not have any uncertainty or doubt about the non-returner’s stage.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Nonreturners who abide in the state of nonreturner🔽

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽dgra bcom pa dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // dgra bcom pa dgra bcom pa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Non-returners do not doubt or waver about their own level.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽rang sangs rgyas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // rang sangs rgyas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Arhats do not doubt or waver about their own level.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Pratyekabuddhas do not doubt or waver about their own level.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas do not doubt or waver about their own level.

original: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: Buddhas do not doubt or waver about their own level.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la gnas pa'ang nem nur med cing the tshom mi za zhing de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la gnas pa'ang nem nur med cing the tshom mi za zhing de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas te /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on his own stage is without doubt and without uncertainty, and he remains on that irreversible stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing @154b yang yongs su sbyong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing @154b yang yongs su sbyong ngo //
translated: He also purifies the buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He also brings beings to maturity.

original: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
translated: He also knows the works of Māra that arise and appear.

original: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
translated: He also does not fall under the power of the works of Māra.

original: bdud kyi las de dag thams cad kyang rnam par 'jom zhing srab mor byed do //
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag thams cad kyang rnam par 'jom zhing srab mor byed do //
translated: He also crushes and weakens all those works of Māra.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / mtshams med pa byed byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'chi ka'i bar du'ang mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
analyzed: dper na / mtshams med pa byed byed pa'i skyes bu ni 'chi ka'i bar du'ang mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
translated: For example, a person who has committed a heinous crime is not separated from the thought of the heinous crime until they die.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: That thought of the heinous crime follows them.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems de thabs thams cad kyis kyang rnam par gzhi la bar mi nus te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de thabs thams cad kyis kyang rnam par gzhi la bar mi nus te /
translated: That thought of the heinous acts cannot be removed by any means whatsoever.

original: kun nas ldang ba de 'chi ka'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba de 'chi ka'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: That thought of the heinous acts follows one even up to the point of death.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the thought of irreversibility of a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible from awakening is established in the irreversible level.

original: sems de rnam par brtag tu med cing mi sgul bas /
analyzed: sems de rnam par brtag tu med cing mi sgul bas /
translated: That thought cannot be analyzed or shaken.

original: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyir bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot turn it back.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de ni 'di ltar sems des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems des lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das te /
translated: Because that thought has transcended the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.🔽It has entered into the faultless.

original: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pas de rang gi sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pas de rang gi sa la gnas shing /
translated: It is established in its own level.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pas /
translated: It has attained the highest perfection of the superknowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: they purify a Buddha-field;

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @155a *//
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams @155a *//
translated: they bring beings to maturity;

original: blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'ang 'gro'o //
analyzed: blta ba dang / de dag la phyag bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du'ang 'gro'o //
translated: and they go from Buddha-field to Buddha-field in order to see the Buddhas, the Lords, to honor them and to hear the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po'ang bskyed cing /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun 'dri zhing yongs su zhu bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po'ang bskyed cing / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la kun 'dri zhing yongs su zhu bar byed /
translated: They plant wholesome roots with those Buddhas, the Lords, in those Buddha-fields;🔽they ask questions of those Buddhas, the Lords, and they honor them.

original: bsnyen bkur ba byed do //🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de ltar gnas pas bdud kyi las skyes shing /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur ba byed do // rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de ltar gnas pas bdud kyi las skyes shing /
translated: They honor those Buddhas, those Lords.

original: byung ba rnams khong du chud de /
analyzed: byung ba rnams khong du chud de /
translated: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who thus stands, recognizes the works of Mara as they arise,

original: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag gi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag gi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
translated: and he does not fall into the power of the works of Mara as they arise.

original: bdud kyi las de dag kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: bdud kyi las de dag kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: and those deeds of Māra he will use skillfully to bring them to the very limit of reality.

original: de rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: de rang gi sa la nem nur med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: He will not be uncertain or doubtful about his own stage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la gcig gam /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la nem nur med pas yang dag pa'i mtha' la gcig gam /
translated: And why?

original: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Because he does not doubt the very limit of reality, and he does not see the very limit of reality as one thing and himself as another.

original: de ltar shes pas de tshe 'phos nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas de tshe 'phos nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar sems mi skye'o //
translated: Knowing this, even when he passes away from there, the thought of the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha will not occur to him.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la chos gang yang skye ba'am /🔽'gag pa 'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la chos gang yang skye ba'am / 'gag pa 'am /
translated: does not see any dharma at all that arises or ceases,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /🔽rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: is defiled or purified,🔽in all dharmas that are empty of their own marks.

original: rab 'byor / @155b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / @155b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de tshe 'phos nas kyang 'di snyam du bdag ni /
translated: “Subhūti, when those bodhisattva great beings have passed away, they do not think,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam mi byed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur ro snyam mi byed de /
translated: ‘I will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro snyam sems so //
translated: They think, ‘I will certainly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor; de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor; de ni 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, it is because unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is empty of its own mark.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rang gi sa la de ltar gnas pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on their own level like that

original: rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sa la thub pa med pa yin te /
translated: are unassailable on their own level.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar gnas pa ni mi 'phrogs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the irreversible bodhisattva great being who is thus situated has the wisdom that cannot be taken away.

original: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du /
translated: Subhūti, if Māra the wicked one, having approached an irreversible bodhisattva great being,

original: bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: were to come in the guise of a buddha and say,

original: 'di skad du khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di skad du khyod kyis 'di nyid du dgra bcom pa thob par gyis shig /
translated: ‘You should attain the state of an arhat right here and now.

original: khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: khyod ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ma bstan to //
translated: You have not been prophesied to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod @156a *//🔽kyis ma thob pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khyod @156a *//🔽kyis ma thob pa /
translated: You have not attained the acceptance that phenomena are not produced, which is the acceptance that phenomena are not produced that those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas have prophesied you to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnam pa gang dag dang / tshul gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag dang / tshul gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang /
translated: “What are the aspects, what are the modes, and what are the signs of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have received their prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood?”

original: mtshan ma de dag kyang khyod la med do zhes zer yang /
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag kyang khyod la med do zhes zer yang /
translated: “Those aspects, those modes, and those signs that bodhisattva great beings who have received a prophecy about unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening have, you do not have those aspects, those modes, and those signs.”

original: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra de thos nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra de thos nas /
translated: If, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, having heard that sound,

original: mi 'jum mi 'god zhing /
analyzed: mi 'jum mi 'god zhing /
translated: are not cowed, do not tense up,

original: de'i sems gzhan du mi 'gyur la yid skrag par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i sems gzhan du mi 'gyur la yid skrag par mi 'gyur na /
translated: and their minds do not turn away, and their minds are not frightened,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis /
analyzed: bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis /
translated: should know that ‘I have been prophesied by those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / gal te bdud sdig to can nam /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag bdag la yod do zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // rab 'byor / gal te bdud sdig to can nam /
translated: “It is thus that he should know that he has those dharmas through which a Bodhisattva, a Great Being, is predicted to full enlightenment.

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i drung du sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, if a son or daughter of good family who has set out in the Bodhisattva Vehicle should see or hear that Māra the wicked one or a person inspired by Māra has approached a Bodhisattva, a Great Being, in the guise of a Buddha🔽and predicted him to the śrāvaka level

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan kyang /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lung bstan kyang /
translated: or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: gal te byang chub sems @156b dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems @156b dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di /
translated: if that Bodhisattva, that Great Being,

original: snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
analyzed: snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni /
translated: thinks, ‘The Tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete Buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: do not predict Bodhisattva great beings to the śrāvaka level🔽or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la yang dag par bskul ba mi mdzad de /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la yang dag par bskul ba mi mdzad de /
translated: and they do not encourage them to attain the level of a solitary buddha.

original: kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam /🔽bdud sdig to can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs so snyam sems pa dang / gal te /
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam / bdud sdig to can gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu zhig sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs so snyam sems pa dang / gal te /
translated: “Alas, this is Mara, the evil one, or an emissary conjured up by Mara!”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la bdud sdig to can sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du nye bar 'ongs nas /
translated: “Subhuti, when a Bodhisattva-mahasattva is reading and reciting the vaipulya sutras, Mara, the evil one, may appear in the guise of a Buddha and say:

original: de la 'di skad du gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du gang la khyod spyod pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni bdud kyis bshad pa yin te /
translated: ‘These sutras that you are practicing are the teachings of Mara.

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: They are not the teachings of the Buddhas, the Tathagatas, nor of the shravakas and pratyekabuddhas.’

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos /
translated: “Subhuti, the Bodhisattva-mahasattva should think:

original: kye ma gang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang 'bral bar byed pa 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam /
analyzed: kye ma gang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang 'bral bar byed pa 'di ni bdud sdig to can nam /
translated: Alas! This is Mara, the evil one, who is trying to separate me from unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu'o zhes bya bar rig par byed na /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @157a *//
analyzed: bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i skyes bu'o zhes bya bar rig par byed na / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs @157a *//
translated: “Alas, this is Mara, the Evil One, or an emissary of Mara, who has come to separate me from unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.”

original: pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin te /
translated: Subhuti, you should know that this Bodhisattva, this great being, has been predicted to full enlightenment by the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that this Bodhisattva, this great being, stands on the irreversible stage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ni de la yod do //
analyzed: gang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag ni de la yod do //
translated: Because those signs, tokens, and indications of irreversible Bodhisattvas, great beings, are found in him.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those modes, and those signs are irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when they practice the perfection of wisdom

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang yongs su gtong la; srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod cing chos de yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang yongs su gtong la; srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod cing chos de yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: give up even themselves for the sake of taking up the holy Dharma, and even if their lives are at risk they do not give up on that Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir 'di ltar brtson par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir 'di ltar brtson par byed de /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings make an effort like that for the sake of taking up the holy Dharma.

original: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung zhing /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung zhing /
translated: They take up the holy Dharma of the past, future, and present lord buddhas,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su mi gtong ba de ltar brtson par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su mi gtong ba de ltar brtson par byed do //
translated: He strives in that way to not abandon the true Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung na 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar @157b byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mchod par 'gyur /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung na 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar @157b byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mchod par 'gyur /
translated: ‘If I uphold the true Dharma, I will make offerings to the bhagavān buddhas of the past, present, and future,
