original: de dag gi dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo //🔽de la chos gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: de dag gi dam pa'i chos kyang yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro snyam mo // de la chos gang gi don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: and I will uphold their true Dharma.’🔽“What is the Dharma for the sake of which the bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not hesitate to give up their bodies and lives?

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa'i chos de gang zhe na /
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang sdod pa'i chos de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that Dharma?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad stong ngo zhes chos ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad stong ngo zhes chos ston te /
translated: “Subhūti, here the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha teaches the Dharma that all dharmas are empty.

original: de la skyes bu blun po la la 'di ni chos ma yin /
analyzed: de la skyes bu blun po la la 'di ni chos ma yin /
translated: Some foolish people say, ‘This is not the Dharma,

original: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin /
translated: this is not the Vinaya,

original: 'di ni ston pas bstan pa ma yin no zhes phyir rgol zhing ngan du brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pas bstan pa ma yin no zhes phyir rgol zhing ngan du brjod de /
translated: They will reject it, saying, “This is not the teaching of the Teacher!” and they will speak badly of it.

original: rab 'byor / chos de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag yongs su gtong zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, for the sake of that Dharma, bodhisattva great beings will give up their own bodies

original: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ngo //
translated: and not give up their lives.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should train like this:

original: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi nang du bdag kyang grangs su gzhug go /
analyzed: gang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag gi nang du bdag kyang grangs su gzhug go /
translated: ‘I will be counted among those who will appear in the future as tathāgatas.

original: bdag kyang der lung bstan to //
analyzed: bdag kyang der lung bstan to //
translated: I will be prophesied there.

original: chos gang gi phyir bdag yongs su gtong ba dang / srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ba de'ang bdag gi chos so zhes bslab bo //
analyzed: chos gang gi phyir bdag yongs su gtong ba dang / srog yongs su chad par 'gyur yang mi gtong ba de'ang bdag gi chos so zhes bslab bo //
translated: That Dharma for the sake of which I will give up my own body and not give up my life is my Dharma.’

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos don gyi dbang 'di mthong bas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, seeing this significance,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang @158a *//🔽yongs su gtong la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir bdag kyang @158a *// yongs su gtong la /
translated: I will give up even my own life for the sake of upholding the holy Dharma.

original: srog yongs su chad pa yin yang sdod pa yin no //
analyzed: srog yongs su chad pa yin yang sdod pa yin no //
translated: I will endure even the severing of my limbs and appendages for the sake of upholding the holy Dharma.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those aspects, that way of being, and those signs

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: are irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa la nem nur med the tshom mi za zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa la nem nur med the tshom mi za zhing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings have no doubt or uncertainty about the Dharma taught by the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly complete buddhas.

original: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gsung ba de thams cad yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gsung ba de thams cad yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: They retain everything those buddha bhagavāns say.

original: de ltar bzung nas kyang chud za bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bzung nas kyang chud za bar mi byed do //
translated: Having retained it, they do not waste it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because they have attained retention.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gzungs gang thob pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gzungs gang thob pas /
translated: “Lord!🔽What dhāraṇīs do bodhisattva great beings attain

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chab mi 'tshal ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chab mi 'tshal ba lags /
translated: so that they do not lose the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs rab tu thob pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mi zad pa'i za ma tog gi gzungs rab tu thob pas /
translated: “Subhūti, by attaining the inexhaustible casket dhāraṇī

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i /
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o //
translated: do not lose the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya dang / padmo rnam par bkod pa dang / yongs @158b su 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya dang / padmo rnam par bkod pa dang / yongs @158b su 'dzin pa'i gzungs rab tu thob pas /
translated: Similarly, by attaining the ocean mudrā, the lotus array, and the total retention dhāraṇīs

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i /
translated: bodhisattva great beings

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo rnams chud mi za'o //
translated: do not lose the sūtras spoken by the Tathāgata.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Lord!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'ba' shig chab mi 'tshal du bas kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa 'ba' shig chab mi 'tshal du bas kyi /
translated: “The Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha has taught this, and I do not doubt it.

original: nyan thos kyis bshad pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis bshad pa ma lags sam /
translated: Was it not taught by the hearers?

original: lhas bshad pa ma lags sam /🔽klus bshad pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: lhas bshad pa ma lags sam / klus bshad pa ma lags sam /
translated: Was it not taught by the gods?🔽Was it not taught by the nāgas?

original: gnod sbyin gyis bshad pa ma lags sam /🔽dri zas bshad pa ma lags sam /🔽lha ma yin gyis bshad pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyis bshad pa ma lags sam / dri zas bshad pa ma lags sam / lha ma yin gyis bshad pa ma lags sam /
translated: Was it not taught by the yakṣas?🔽Was it not taught by the gandharvas?🔽Was it not taught by the asuras?

original: nam mkha'i lding gis bshad pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: nam mkha'i lding gis bshad pa ma lags sam /
translated: Was it not taught by the garuḍas?

original: lto 'phye chen pos bshad pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen pos bshad pa ma lags sam /
translated: Was it not taught by the mahoragas?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /🔽skad dang / brda' dang / sgra gang yang rung ste /🔽de dag thams cad la nem nur med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni / skad dang / brda' dang / sgra gang yang rung ste / de dag thams cad la nem nur med /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings

original: the tshom med do //
analyzed: the tshom med do //
translated: have no doubts or uncertainties about any language, sign, or sound.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar des gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar des gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained the dhāraṇīs.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa de dag dang / tshul de dag dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Subhūti, you should know that bodhisattva great beings who have those attributes, those modes, and those signs

original: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par rig par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: are irreversible.

original: le'u bzhi bcu pa'o ////
analyzed: le'u bzhi bcu pa'o ////
translated: This was the fortieth chapter, “Irreversibility,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyis brgya so brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po nyis brgya so brgyad pa /
translated: Fascicle 88

original: de skad ces bka' @159a *//
analyzed: de skad ces bka' @159a *//
translated: Having been thus instructed,

original: stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible have great qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshad ma mchis /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshad ma mchis /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are immeasurable,

original: grangs ma mchis /
analyzed: grangs ma mchis /
translated: incalculable,

original: dpag tu ma mchis pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu ma mchis pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with immeasurable good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bskyod du ma mchis pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bskyod du ma mchis pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are endowed with unshakable good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldeg pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldeg pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni yon tan chen po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are endowed with great good qualities.

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshad med /
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni tshad med /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are endowed with immeasurable,

original: grangs med / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: uncountable, and limitless good qualities.

original: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bskyod du med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni bskyod du med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings who are irreversible are endowed with unshakable good qualities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes mtha' yas mu med pa rab tu thob ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes mtha' yas mu med pa rab tu thob ste /
translated: It is because he has attained the infinite, limitless wisdom that is not shared in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ye shes de la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @159b sems dpa' chen po /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par bsgrub pa gang gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dris kyang /
analyzed: ye shes de la gnas shing phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @159b sems dpa' chen po / so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par bsgrub pa gang gis lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dris kyang /
translated: Abiding in that wisdom, the bodhisattva great being🔽accomplishes the analytical knowledges, by means of which the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is unable to exhaust his answers.

original: lan zad par mi nus pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par sgrub bo //🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: lan zad par mi nus pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa mngon par sgrub bo // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: He accomplishes the analytical knowledges.🔽Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par yang rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por brjod pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la ni gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par yang rnam pa gang dang / tshul gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen por brjod pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rnam pa dang /
translated: “Blessed One, if the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha has the power to reveal the aspects, modes, and signs of irreversible bodhisattva great beings for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,

original: tshul dang / mtshan ma rnams ston pa'i mthu mnga' na /
analyzed: tshul dang / mtshan ma rnams ston pa'i mthu mnga' na /
translated: then why does he not reveal the aspects, modes, and signs of irreversible bodhisattva great beings for those who are irreversible?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang la gnas shing /
analyzed: gang la gnas shing /
translated: what is the basis

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: on which bodhisattva great beings practice the six perfections?

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / dbang po lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: They perfect the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties,

original: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yongs su @160a *//
analyzed: stobs lnga yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yongs su @160a *//
translated: the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path. They perfect the noble truths.

original: rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / tshad med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / bsam gtan rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / tshad med pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: They perfect the meditative stabilities, they perfect the immeasurable aspirations, they perfect the formless meditative stabilities, they perfect the eight aspects of liberation,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: they perfect the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, they perfect the emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness that are doors to liberation, they perfect the superknowledges,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the meditative stabilities. It is to perfect the dhāraṇī gateways. It is to perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas. It is to perfect the four fearlessnesses.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / byams pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang /
translated: It is to perfect the four detailed and thorough knowledges. It is to perfect great love. It is to perfect great compassion. It is to perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam pa thams cad @160b mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa'i gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa dang / rnam pa thams cad @160b mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par bgyid pa'i gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol /
translated: the perfection of all-knowledge, the perfection of the knowledge of path aspects, and the perfection of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: “Good, Subhūti!

original: legs so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: legs so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Good, Subhūti!

original: khyod de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas zab mo rnams dri bar sems pa legs so //
analyzed: khyod de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas zab mo rnams dri bar sems pa legs so //
translated: You have thought it out well in asking the Tathāgata about these deep matters for the sake of irreversible bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “Subhūti, ‘deep’ is a synonym for emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / zhi ba dang /
translated: This is a synonym for signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-production, freedom from desire, cessation, nirvāṇa, peace,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig bla dvags so // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: suchness, the very limit of reality, and the dharma-constituent.🔽Subhūti, these are called the profound words and expressions.

original: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags de dag ni gnas zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go /
analyzed: gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags de dag ni gnas zab mo zab mo zhes bya ba de dag go /
translated: The Lord: These are the profound words and expressions for nirvāṇa.

original: gsol pa / de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags su bas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags ma lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags su bas kyi chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags ma lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Subhūti: Are they only words and expressions for nirvāṇa, or are they also words and expressions for all dharmas?

original: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags kyang yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / zab mo zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dvags kyang yin no //
translated: The Lord: Subhūti, they are also words and expressions for all dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
